sentences.sentence: There are emotional gatherings as different parts of the world mark the first anniversary of the war in Ukraine with vigils.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: The United Nations voted overwhelmingly to demand Russia immediately and unconditionally withdraw its troops from Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The partner of JLD Vukaili, the former Vice President of the European Parliament, has been released but must wear an electronic tag.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Different parts of the world are marking the first anniversary of the Russian invasion of Ukraine with vigils.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: People gathered at this one in London's Trafalgar Square to show their support for those still living in the war-torn country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: We speak to them, we ask about the situation in Ukraine, we support them.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: So they need emotional, psychological support, but also we learn from them how to be strong.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: They tell us, guys, we will win.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: So they tell us, don't worry, just help, give us help as much as you can, and we will stay strong, we will win.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: In Brussels, the Ukrainian flag colours lit up the buildings of the European institutions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: In Paris, the Eiffel Tower also lit up in yellow and blue, as well as the Parliament building in Portugal.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: The support and solidarity on the first year anniversary of the invasion also came from the other side of the Atlantic.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: In New York, dozens of people gathered in front of the Russian consulate to protest against the war.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: A year ago, Putin started a war against Ukraine. I have family in Ukraine, I have family in Russia, and I'm against Putin.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: I'm against what he's doing.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: I'm against him taking the territories that do not belong to him.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Most of the world seems to stand in solidarity with Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: There's no end in sight yet.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: However, according to recent polls, Europeans and Americans share the goal of Ukraine victory, even if this means prolonging the war.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The United Nations voted overwhelmingly to demand Russia immediately and unconditionally

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: withdraw its troops from Ukraine. At the General Assembly, 141 members voted in favor of the resolution, reaffirming support for Ukraine's sovereignty and territorial integrity. However, seven opposed it and 32 abstained, including China and India. We are satisfied with the outcome and the message is clear. It doesn't matter what Russia tries and how it attempts to undermine international order and the coalition in support of Ukraine's territorial integrity.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: It fails one time after another. The EU's foreign affairs chief says most of the world has the same message. On the Russian side there is a small handful of votes confirming that in the eyes of the world the aggression against Ukraine needs to stop and it needs to stop now and open the door to a just, sustainable and comprehensive peace.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: However, Hungary has prevented the 27 member states from agreeing on a new round of sanctions against Russia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: But ministers will meet again to try to reach an agreement in the coming days.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile, the US has announced a new package of sanctions, which it says will be sweeping.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: In addition, the White House has announced that it'll approve a new aid package for Kyiv. Before the war, the city of

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Marinka, located near Donetsk, had more than 9,000 inhabitants. A year after the Russian invasion, devastation is everywhere, and there is no one left in this ghost town nestled in the middle of the battlefront. Наразі цивільного населення в Мар'їнці немає, тому що силами військової адміністрації та поліції ми евакуювали все населення, всіх дітей із Мар'їнки, тому що немає там можливості для життя цивільного населення. Bells rang out in Kyiv at midnight to mark the first anniversary of the war in Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: The capital is far away from the worst days of the invasion, but the conflict is still very much alive in the East and in the South.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: I was scared. I didn't know what was waiting for us. It was not like now. We are so confident in our army that we are very calm.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: We are walking. I don't know what will happen tomorrow. We don't know.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: But at the moment we are very inspired. In his nightly address, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said he's continuing with positive diplomatic talks and discussions on gathering more weapons.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: However, tens of thousands of Ukrainians have died so far.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: They'll be remembered on Friday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: As the war rages on, the Ukrainians continue with their determination and hope in their hearts for victory. war rages on, the Ukrainians continue with their determination and hope in their hearts for victory.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Ukraine boycotted the latest meeting of the Organization for Security and Cooperation

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: in Europe over the presence of Russian lawmakers that they described as an affront.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The event was held in Vienna. Austria granted them visas, even though they're under European Union sanctions, and despite protests from 20 countries including Britain, France and Canada. Some delegates left the room when the floor was given to a Russian parliamentarian, others voiced their anger.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: It's a disgrace that this delegation is here, particularly the delegation that consists of members who are sanctioned individuals who voted to annex independent countries' territories, Donbass, Kherson, Soporizhia Oblast, Lugansk.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Those are the principles this institution was vouched to protect and guard.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: Russian MPs were not invited to previous OSCE meetings in the United Kingdom and Poland, but Austria, as the host country of the organization, claims to be bound by an international agreement. It is of course difficult to sit with Russian parliamentarians who have blindly supported the Kremlin's war, but it is important that the Russian MPs hear our message.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: I will be sure to let them know that we reject the war and that OSCE Parliamentary Assembly supports Ukraine. Demonstrators also gathered in front of the venue to denounce the presence of Russian deputies and the war crimes of Vladimir Putin.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: When Ukrainians woke up to the sound of Russian missiles exploding in their towns and cities, millions of them fled to train stations.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: There were no tickets to take them to safety as such, but there were trains to take them further west, away from the fighting.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Since the start of the Russian invasion, Ukraine railways have transported four million people to western Ukraine and over half a million to destinations outside the country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The company had to change timetables daily, depending on where civilians needed to be evacuated from most urgently.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Getting on the train, people often didn't know where they were going to, but they knew where they were escaping from.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Those days were a nightmare, but we gave our citizens, our people, the feeling that they should get to the station and that would be enough. They are safe, they can get first aid, medical aid, psychological aid, some food, hot tea and get evacuated until the end of the day. Slow, uncomfortable, but get evacuated to a safer place.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: created to save our place.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Like many people, like many companies, like many institutions in Ukraine, we were preparing for the war.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: But we were not ready for such kind of the war.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Full scale invasion with shellings, with air bombing and so on.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: So finally, I don't want to be in the case anymore where I would be not ready for something. That's why since summer we are ready for everything. We are in different environments. We are preparing for any scenario that could happen.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Ukrainian resilience in the face of the Russian onslaught extends to its railways.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03

sentences.sentence: It was complicated because we had to repair the infra, the mine, track station, and all the area.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Disgraced Hollywood producer Harvey Weinstein has been sentenced by a Los Angeles court to an additional 16 years in prison for rape and sexual assaults. The 70-year-old was found guilty of attacking an actress during a film festival in the city in 2013.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: He denies the charges.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: The jury acquitted him of sexual battery of a massage therapist and failed to reach verdicts on counts involving two other women.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Weinstein, who's already serving 23 years for an earlier conviction in New York, begged the judge not to give him a life term.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Francesco Giorgi, the partner of former European Parliament Vice President Eva Kiley,

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: has been freed from jail but will wear an electronic bracelet.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: The announcement was made on Thursday by the Belgian Federal Prosecutor's Office.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Eva Kiley remains behind bars.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Both are implicated in a corruption scandal in the European Parliament involving Qatar and Morocco. Investigators found 150,000 euros in cash at Kiley's Brussels home. MEPs Marc Tarabella and Pier Antonio Panzeri are also in custody.
